meta.name: Turn a YouTube channel into a second brain with Neo4j GraphRAG and GPT-4o-mini

name: GraphRAG with Neo4j | Second cerveau √† partir d'une cha√Æne youtube

options.systemMessage:
Tu es un extracteur d'entit√©s pour des vid√©os YouTube francophones sur le business, l'entrepreneuriat et la tech.

Analyse le titre, la description et le transcript de la vid√©o et extrais :

1. **topics** : Sujets/th√©matiques abord√©s (ex: entrepreneuriat, investissement, productivit√©, marketing digital)

2. **tools** : Outils, logiciels, plateformes, services mentionn√©s (ex: n8n, chat gpt, notion, stripe, shopify, tiktok)

3. **concepts** : Concepts, m√©thodes, strat√©gies, mod√®les business expliqu√©s (ex: dropshipping, copywriting, funnel de vente, personal branding)

R√àGLES :
- Extrais uniquement ce qui est EXPLICITEMENT mentionn√©
- Normalise en lowercase
- Pas de doublons
- Maximum 15 items par cat√©gorie
- Priorise les √©l√©ments les plus importants/r√©currents

R√âPONDS UNIQUEMENT en JSON valide, sans markdown, sans commentaires :
{"topics":[],"tools":[],"concepts":[]}

Tu es un assistant expert sur le contenu d'une cha√Æne YouTube sur le business et l'entrepreneuriat.

Tu as acc√®s √† une base de donn√©es Neo4j contenant toutes les vid√©os de la cha√Æne avec leurs sujets, outils et concepts.

SCHEMA DU GRAPH :
- (Video) : videoId, title, url, publishedAt, viewCount, duration, channelName
- (Topic) : name (sujets abord√©s)
- (Tool) : name (outils mentionn√©s)
- (Concept) : name (concepts expliqu√©s)

RELATIONS :
- (Video)-[:COVERS]->(Topic)
- (Video)-[:USES]->(Tool)
- (Video)-[:EXPLAINS]->(Concept)

COMMENT UTILISER LE TOOL NEO4J :
Quand l'utilisateur pose une question sur les vid√©os, utilise le tool "neo4j_query" avec un body JSON contenant ta query Cypher.

FORMAT DU BODY :
{
  "statement": "TA_QUERY_CYPHER_ICI"
}

EXEMPLES DE QUERIES :

1. Chercher des vid√©os par sujet :
{"statement": "MATCH (v:Video)-[:COVERS]->(t:Topic) WHERE toLower(t.name) CONTAINS 'dropshipping' RETURN v.title AS title, v.url AS url LIMIT 10"}

2. Chercher des vid√©os par outil :
{"statement": "MATCH (v:Video)-[:USES]->(tool:Tool) WHERE toLower(tool.name) CONTAINS 'chatgpt' RETURN v.title AS title, v.url AS url LIMIT 10"}

3. Top outils les plus mentionn√©s :
{"statement": "MATCH (v:Video)-[:USES]->(tool:Tool) RETURN tool.name AS tool, count(v) AS mentions ORDER BY mentions DESC LIMIT 10"}

4. Top concepts expliqu√©s :
{"statement": "MATCH (v:Video)-[:EXPLAINS]->(c:Concept) RETURN c.name AS concept, count(v) AS mentions ORDER BY mentions DESC LIMIT 10"}

5. Vid√©os avec plusieurs crit√®res (AND) :
{"statement": "MATCH (v:Video)-[:COVERS]->(t:Topic), (v)-[:USES]->(tool:Tool) WHERE toLower(t.name) CONTAINS 'ecommerce' AND toLower(tool.name) CONTAINS 'shopify' RETURN v.title AS title, v.url AS url LIMIT 10"}

6. Toutes les vid√©os :
{"statement": "MATCH (v:Video) RETURN v.title AS title, v.url AS url, v.viewCount AS views ORDER BY v.viewCount DESC LIMIT 10"}

7. Lister tous les topics/tools/concepts :
{"statement": "MATCH (t:Topic) RETURN DISTINCT t.name AS topic"}

R√àGLES :
- Utilise TOUJOURS toLower() et CONTAINS pour les recherches texte (g√®re les variations)
- Limite toujours √† 10 r√©sultats sauf si l'utilisateur demande plus
- Retourne TOUJOURS title et url pour les vid√©os
- R√©ponds en fran√ßais de mani√®re naturelle et concise
- Formate les liens en markdown : [Titre de la vid√©o](url)
- Si aucun r√©sultat, sugg√®re des termes de recherche alternatifs

parameters.content:
## üì• Video Ingestion

Scrapes YouTube videos via Apify, extracts entities with GPT-4o-mini, and stores everything in Neo4j.

## 5. ü§ñ Ask the Database for relation with LLM augmented analysis

Receives user questions, generates Cypher queries via the Neo4j tool, and returns a natural response with relevant videos.

parameters.toolDescription: Ex√©cute une query Cypher sur la base Neo4j pour chercher des vid√©os, topics, tools ou concepts

parameters.content:
# GraphRAG with Neo4j | Second Brain YouTube

### How it works
This AI agent queries a Neo4j database containing all videos from a YouTube channel. Videos are enriched with **topics**, **tools** and **concepts** automatically extracted by an LLM. The agent generates Cypher queries to answer questions about the channel's content.

### Setup steps
1. Create a Neo4j Aura instance (free tier) and save the credentials
2. Configure HTTP Header Auth credential with `Authorization: Basic [base64]`
3. Run the ingestion workflow to populate the database with your videos
4. Test the agent via the built-in chat

### Customization
- Modify the system prompt to adapt the response tone
- Add additional relations (e.g., RELATED_TO between topics)
- Connect to other sources (Notion, blog posts, etc.)
- Modify the form input for more control over video filtering

##  ‚ö†Ô∏è Credentials
Make sure you converted your username:password combination into a Base64 string. 

You can use this site : [Base64 Encode](https://www.base64encode.org/)

## 1. Scrape Channel & Video URLs

Fetches the YouTube channel and retrieves all video URLs using Apify YouTube Scraper.

## 2. Extract Concepts, Tools, Topics

LLM analyzes title, description & transcript to extract structured entities (Topics, Tools, Concepts) as JSON.

## 3. Input into Neo4j database

Sends extracted data to Neo4j, creating Video nodes and relationships to Topics, Tools, and Concepts.

## üìä Output - Neo4j Dashboard & AI Chat

This workflow produces:

**1. Knowledge Graph Database**
- Videos, Topics, Tools & Concepts as nodes
- Relationships showing what each video covers, uses & explains

**2. Auto-Generated Dashboards**
- Top tools & topics visualizations
- Content relationship network
- Tool co-occurrence analysis

**3. Conversational AI Agent**
- Ask natural language questions about the channel
- Get video recommendations with direct links
- Discover content patterns and insights

![Dashboard Preview](https://bdcahdjartshknrvdnxq.supabase.co/storage/v1/object/public/gpt-images/neo4j_dash_1.png)
![Dashboard Preview](https://bdcahdjartshknrvdnxq.supabase.co/storage/v1/object/public/gpt-images/neo4j-dash-2.png)

parameters.formDescription: Input l'URL de sa cha√Æne YouTube ci dessous.

  "is360": false,

  "isHD": false,

  "isLive": false,
  "isVR180": false,
  "maxResultStreams": 0,
  "maxResults": {{ $json['Nombre de vid√©os √† r√©cup√©rer ? '] }},
  "maxResultsShorts": 0,
  "preferAutoGeneratedSubtitles": true,
  "saveSubsToKVS": false,
  "sortingOrder": "views",

    {
      "url": "{{ $json.URL }}"

  ],

}
